Package collector.data

collector.data

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Element An Element is the basic piece of data.
 

Class Summary
BaseDeDonnees Template for all classes
CellFactory CellFactory creates new Cell from XML Events.
CellInt An Cell is the basic piece of data, always associated to a Field.
CellStr An Cell is the basic piece of data, always associated to a Field.
DataContentHandler To parse a XMLReader that should contain a Element
Enregistrement An Enregistrement is an Array of Cell and an unique key.
EnregistrementFactory EnregistrementFactory creates new Enregistrement from XML Events.
Field A Field is the basic component of the header of a Table.
FieldFactory FieldFactory creates new Field from XML Events.
Header A Header is an ordered list of Field.
HeaderFactory Creates an Header from XML.
SearchedElement A SearchedElement is used to look for a given Enregistrement in a Table.
SearchOperator The search operator contains a list of SearchedElement and operates on a Table.
Table A Table is the root piece of info.
TableFactory Creates Table from File.
View A View is a Table used for storing result of search.
 

Package collector.data Description

collector.data

Todo

Mettre en place dans parentTable un Enregistrement bison dont tout le monde puisse hériter.

Element and ElementFactory

An Element is the basic piece of knowledge of the database, and it can be saved as XML Element.toXML( DataWriter w ) and displayed as String Element.displayData(). To read, you must use the DataContentHandler that uses a ElementFactory to process the XML events. New Element can then be retrived by DataContentHandler.getData().

Alain Dutech
